marklogic.body:
Sal, here is the High Flight Poem in words. High Flight
Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth And danced the skies on laughter-silvered wings; Sunward I've climbed, and joined the tumbling mirth Of sun-split clouds, â€” and done a hundred things You have not dreamed of â€” wheeled and soared and swung High in the sunlit silence. Hov'ring there, I've chased the wind along, and flung My eager craft through footless Halls of air. . . .
Up, up the long, delirious Burning blue I've topped the wind-swept heights with easy grace Where never lark, or ever eagle flew â€” And, while with silent, lifting mind I've trod The high untrespassed sanctity of space, Put out my hand, and touched the face of God. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tXbA6Ya9yJI â€” John Gillespie Magee, Jr
